title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SCORE
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview over Zoom. They ask about your background, analytics, and what you would contribute. Be prepared to come up with a strategy on the spot for one of their audiences.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to talk about analytics and develop a strategy on the spot.

title: Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, professional and friendly. Met with HR first and had to complete a writing / editing timed test, then direct supervisor, then team, then finally a follow up to answer any questions I had.  All conducted by Zoom. Each time the interview started on time and was very smooth.
Interview Questions: What would you do if an employee that reports to you did not complete assigned work on time?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at SCORE (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met as a freelancer at a Panera Bread, talked about what was needed and what the job was, then went on to talking me through what SCORE did and what they were trying to accomplish through the brochure.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in doing some freelance work for us and designing a brochure and bookmark.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SCORE in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
PHONE INTERVIEW

standard interview question i.e describe yourself, your last project, your availability,

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SCORE in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my cover letter and resume for the position, I was called for an interview with the Director. It was a pretty relaxed interview basically reviewing the duties and responsibilities of the position and discussing how my skills and previous experience would apply. We also discussed how I would react in certain situations that were likely to occur such as being given an assignment that required team collaboration to meet a short deadline or working more than 40 hours in a week to complete a project. The interview lasted about 40 minutes and I heard back from the Director within a week.
Interview Questions: Of the responsibilities listed, which do you think will be the most challenging?
